re :3. Messages I do not want to see (at that time) are opened uncontrollably, sometimes in large numbers. Apparently related to multiple recipients on a thread. I am wasting a lot of time closing maybe dozens of unwanted messages.

The new default in Thunderbird (set by developers) is to use 'View' > 'Sort by' > 'Threaded' It sounds like you are clicking on a collapsed top level thread.

If you click on the top level thread which is in a collapsed state, that sends the instruction to open all the threads in new tabs. This is not new, but if you have not used 'Threads' before it can seem like an annoyance. You have a choice.

  • Either switch off threading: View > Sort by > Unthreaded
  • OR click on the chevron to expand the thread and then select the individual email you want to open.

2. The ability to adjust message magnification/font size with Conntrol “+” and “-“ has disappeared. I have to copy message contents into Word now to enlarge enough to read.

The 'Menu app' icon (3 lines) is on the 'Unified toolbar' Click on 'Menu app' icon and you should see 'Font Size' which has the options + and - OR via 'Menu Bar' toolbar - 'View' > 'Font Size' > increase/decrease font size

This option effects all of the UI.

If you only need to increase the font size in the 'Message Pane' then you do it via:

  • Settings > General
  • scroll to 'Language & Appearance'
  • click on 'Advanced' button
  • 'Fonts for' - select 'Latin' (this sets encodings for western)
  • Set 'Proportional - Sans Serf - Size: 16 (try 16 as a start)
  • Set 'Monospace' - Consolas - Size: 16
  • Set 'Minimum font size:' Try 12 (it must not be higher than what is set for the others)

Now you need to set up encodings for 'Unicode'

  • 'Fonts for' - select 'Other Writing Systems' (it's at the bottom of drop down list)

You must set the same as you set up for 'Latin'

  • Set 'Proportional - Sans Serf - Size: 16 (try 16 as a start)
  • Set 'Monospace' - Consolas - Size: 16
  • Set 'Minimum font size:' Try 12 (it must not be higher than what is set for the others)
  • Reselect 'Fonts for' - select 'Latin'
  • Uncheck 'Allow messages to use other fonts'
  • Click on 'OK'

I can duplicate it. Select email so it shows in Message Pane Then click in the actual opened message to put focus on the message itself Use 'Menu Bar' - click on 'Message' > Move to > select another folder in account. This fails in beta 121.0b5, but does work in 102.15.1

But it works if you select email in list and use : 'Menu Bar' - click on 'Message' > Move to > select another folder in account. OR use Right click on selected email in list and use 'Move to' > select folder

An alternative method also works - Right click on opened email (not email in list) and use 'Move to' > select folder

  • click on 'Move to' in Unified Toolbar and select folder

content: I remember your request. Every request caused a new post, so there was never any continuity in your request. We asked for examples of the problem, which you never provided. All we knew was that you couldn't send email, which seems to be a recurring problem for you. To work toward solutions on a technical forum, one must 1) maintain a single thread so all supporters can readily follow and contribute, and 2) provide requested information so persons here will be able to offer assistance. I am pleased you were able to resolve your issue, and working face-to-face may work best for you. Others have had issues where they could not respond via email, so they used their online accounts to do so. On you comment about Thunderbird changing settings, it does NOT do that. I have used Thunderbird for two decades and the only changes have been done by me. I do regret we were unable to assist.
